Idiom (Lojban): lo menli cu bajra ca'o lo djedi
Syntactic Structure & Grammatical Form: fixed clause with subject 'lo menli' and intransitive verb 'bajra'
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To be mentally active or restless; to overthink or daydream continuously.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Derived from early Lojbanist online forums describing ‘mental running’ during logical debates.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Lojban): [lo ˈmen.li ʃu ˈbadʒ.ra ˈʃa.o lo ˈdʒe.di]
First Example Sentence: mi pu cusku lo du'u lo menli cu bajra ca'o lo nicte
Second Example Sentence: do viska lo nu mi menli cu bajra gi'e na sipna
Third Example Sentence: lo cmalu tavla cu djuno lo du'u lo menli cu bajra

Idiom (Lojban): lo janco cu darxi lo jamfu
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: To harm oneself through one’s own actions; to act against one’s interests.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: mi zukte lo nu mi te katna mi
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Popularized in 21st-century Lojban IRC channels; modeled after English ‘shoot oneself in the foot’.

Second Example Sentence: ko na janco darxi lo jamfu ca lo nu do tavla
Third Example Sentence: lo smuni cu du lo nu do darxi lo do jamfu
